review_title: pittsburgh is a great city, good people and community
pros: pittsburgh is a great city, good people and community, constantly growing and evolving, becoming more hip and a true hub for innovation.
cons: every position is different depending on department and leader, not many cons.

pros: The city is great. Low cost of living and in 3 years has seen quite the boom.
cons: The work environment is highly dependent on the supervisor and how they run their lab. Could be the best experience ever or the worst

review_title: Not at it used to be
job_title: PhD Graduate Student in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Pitt still has a good reputation and good connections, both very useful  for career development.
cons: There are a lot of hand-on activities but equipment and facilities are subpar. Education isn't that good either, compared to European alternatives.

pros: Very good research and teaching university. Great environment and funding. Health insurance is great
cons: Low efficient management. Low salary. Research treat (more than 1 day) for Ph.D. candidates and postdocs should be arranged to enhance the scientific communication and socialization.

pros: Benefits are simply amazing and run the gamut
cons: Continue many of the antiquated attitudes toward flexible schedules and working remotely

job_title: Major Gifts Officer in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Free bus pass. Tuition benefit, 401k match and health benefits are great.
cons: Parking can be tough and costly. Communication between leadership is very unclear and indecisive at times.

pros: Had the opportunity to grow intellectually and do lost of different research
cons: They pay very low wages for students and full time workers...for students minimum wage for others below market

review_title: Difficult to Progress as an RA
pros: Offers health insurance and great retirement benefits
cons: little opportunity for advancement of salary/title, any yearly raises are not merit based, raises are variable year to year and not significant, little to no consequences for bad/lazy workers

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: I have enjoyed working here- the healthcare is great and its pretty drama free.
cons: The weather in pittsburgh is not for me-- its dark all winter. Summer is nice but the rest of very wet and dark.

review_title: Good work environment, work-life balance and benefits package
pros: Competitive environment, colleagues are helpful, no racial discrimination, productive and reward oriented work culture, wonderful healthcare facilities for employees.
cons: Lower salary, slow and lousy administration.

review_title: Easy-going place to work as a student
pros: Laid back, flexible with time relating to school work you have to do / classes you are taking. Nice people
cons: Pay is low. Only get paid once a month instead of every two weeks.

review_title: Nice city, but salary is a little bit low
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: environment, city, and professors are things that make me happy here!
cons: living here is on expensive side and sometimes salary can not compensate it , depends on which department you are working in.

review_title: The climate is fine...it really depends on who you work with, sometimes very disappointing
pros:
Most of the people here are nice.
Work is not challenge
cons: Sometimes you have to work on something you are not well trained for

pros: Amazing learning opportunities. Education benefits.
cons: Pitt's compensation system is terrible. If you start at the bottom your pay will be tied to that initial salary regardless of how much experience or education you obtain.

pros: I absolutely loved working here! Lots of different projects to be a part of. You have a chance to manage things if you do well and to have a real influence
cons: Sometimes you have to work long hours

review_title: Good Research Group but not Salary
pros:
The professor is very well educated and is good at her field. 
Co-workers are easy to get along with since there are not many to begin with.
cons: Salary is based on grant. What do you think?

pros: independence, avenues for creativity, stability, camaraderie.
cons: Pay is low, once you are here there is little done to keep you happy.

job_title: Graduate Student Researcher in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Wonderful calendar of guest and internal speakers. Myriad seminar series to attend. Excellent cultural opportunities in the region, even on a grad student budget.
cons: Very few direct flights from Pgh airport. A miniscule quibble.

pros: Flexible time, health benefits, retirement benefits, Pitt perks and eligibility for family members to study for free
cons: No bonus, very little hike in salary, career prospects, starting salary is low

job_title: Audio Visual Technician in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Worked in the School of Nursing. Relatively laid back environment and work was simple after a few days. Most faculty and staff were easy to get along with.
cons: Faculty could overreact over things you're not responsible for.

pros: Benefits medical, dental, vision, 403B
cons: They  treat employees like children with unnecessary and unlimited  restrictions and do not pay well 1-2% salary increase. For example, if you are 5 minutes late or leave 5 minutes early,  you are criticized even though you stay later or come in earlier  without overtime pay. Very little positive motivation and kudos!

job_title: IT Manager/Database Administrator in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Job stability;  Great benefits!;  Cutting edge research and technology;  Outstanding leadership;  Terrific work / life balance;  Free bus rides!
cons: Parking and transportation options are limited.

job_title: Research Laboratory Technician III in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: - awesome place to work, great benefits
cons: - pay is low, raises are abysmal.  Need to leave the University to get a significant bump in pay and then return later....if you want a significant raise.

pros: The workplace is a nice environment, good associates, great mentorship, interesting work. Opportunity to collaborate. Build independence.
cons: It is a very competitive position, long work hours are expected. It takes a lot of experience and devotion.

pros: Overall this company was positive. My colleagues were pleasant there for me when I needed it. The benefits were good.
cons: This was a very stressful job. The clients were challenging and the rotating work schedule didn't help.

pros: Good health insurance. Schedule flexibility. Oakland is a reasonably pleasant location to work in, with good bus service, parks, and old buildings.
cons: University of Pittsburgh is becoming increasingly corporatized in its structures, priorities, and hiring practices.

pros: It is a easy job and not stressful. You get paid on an hourly basis, and the work will help you understand the coursework better.
cons: This is not a complicate job, so it will pay a lot.

job_title: Research Technician II in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Great opportunity for professional growth. Excellent opportunity for those seeking entry-level positions. An oustanding employer for those seeking to further their education at some point.
cons: Financial compensation in comparison to similar jobs elsewhere is very underwhelming.

job_title: Research Specialist IV in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Lots of free training sessions and seminars / Benefits for continuing education / 401k / Health Insurance
cons: Salaries are lower than other cities but the cost of living in Pittsburgh is not that high anyway...

review_title: I have been working at the University of Pittsburgh full-time as a graduate assistant.
pros: Waived tuition, great benefits, healthcare, nice environment to study and work
cons: Some politics behind administrations and management, and conflicts between professors impacted research and collaborations.

job_title: Information Technology Specialist in Mechanicsburg, PA
pros:
Pay was on higher end of bracket
Not bad for Recent Grad
Flexible Schedule
Great management
cons:
Slow Hiring Process
Monthly pay for satellite campuses
Benefits not as good if you are not on main campus

pros: Exceptional place to work. Exceptional benefits, multi-cultural, opportunities for continuous learning and growth. Great staff employees who are dedicated to the University.
cons: Lower salaries than external competitors. Need to leave to increase compensation.

review_title: University of pittsburgh, Department of Microbiology and Molecular Genetics
pros: very good department for virology research postdoctoral training.
cons: you need to work for long hours, chances of getting promoted is very less.

pros: Great opportunity to learn how to teach during recitation hours.
cons: Not good enough salary for a person who is teaching( it was like 4000 USD per semester for 20 hours  every week)

pros: Benefits are good and people are generally very nice and helpful.
cons: Disorganized with contracts and not transparent about responsibilities upfront.

review_title: Big place, wide variables in pay and management styles
pros: Respected University, Oakland area is fun/active
cons: Near impossible to advance within. External applicants seem to have an advantage especially in salary negotiations.

review_title: data analyst at pharmacy school. •	Pulled data from multiple sources, manipulated and consolidated variables for modelin
pros: flexible working time, nice boss, excellent education benefits, medical insurance.
cons: Bad  politics,low pay,  less entertainment, some restaurant was not good.

pros: Free tuition (have to pay taxes).
cons: The location of the University of Pittsburgh makes any commute to work awful. If you don't have a masters degree, you will not have room for upward movement.

pros: wonderful staff, you be carefully trained for all duties, interesting multitasking work with research subjects and data, flexible schedule, great benefits, carrier development if motivated
cons: need to pay for car parking

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: UPMC health insurance is one of the best around
cons: Multiple hoops need to be jumped in order to get a raise above 10%. Contracts can take a while to be drawn up and approved.

pros: Friendly co-workers. Highly motivated colleagues but willing to take the time to get to know you.
cons: I think that maybe it's a little stressful, but that's just the atmosphere of working in a lab.

pros: Opportunity to develop teaching skills and grow as an educator
cons: Can be demanding at the end of the semester if you are simultaneously doing research, taking classes as well as teaching.

review_title: One of the best student jobs available!
pros:
- Supervisors are VERY considerate of academic commitments
- Flexible Schedule
- Interesting work
cons: - Might not get as much time to do homework since it's not a work study position

review_title: One of the Greatest Places to Work
job_title: Undergraduate Program Administrator in Gurgaon, Haryana
pros: Great hours, flexible days, benefits are great, available training for staff, ability to use creative talents
cons: Low salary and will not increase employee pay grade if you qualify

review_title: good working environment, nice people, underpaid
job_title: Graduate Student Researcher in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: good working environment, not stressful, nice people around, a good start for one's career path,
cons: salary's non competitive, felt underpaid, master or lower degrees are enough for applying a job

review_title: I work as a graduate research assistant.
job_title: Graduate Student Researcher in Pittsburgh, PA
pros:
1. provide nice research environment and opportunities for conferences.
2. campus sits in a nice neighborhood. you can also select courses in CMU
cons: I do not find obvious cons

pros:
Most faculties are very nice. 
Research Topics are very interesting.
Both of the city and university are getting better these years. Big companies come.
Great Healthcare
cons: Need more parking lots in the campus

job_title: Graduate Student Researcher in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: If you have a good advisor, graduate studies here can be great.
cons: It's an investment... We'll see if it pays off

job_title: Part Time Instructor in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Excellent benefits and work environment; availability of resources and support for teaching.
cons: Can't always predict when you'll be teaching a class

pros: Supportive administration, lots of opportunities for professional development
cons: Work satisfaction is dependent on individual department; sometimes there is a lack of transparency from upper administration and a lack of coordination across departments

job_title: Research Assistant Professor in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Benefits - retirement best in class for pittsburgh area by far.  Salary is OK, 2.5% salary increase each year is typical
cons: Administration - old school and not flexible if you have a family

pros: Very satisfied with the job as they provide the students with all the facilities to move ahead in the career
cons: Nothing in specific. Everything is good.

pros: Great, friendly colleagues and a great work environment. Very helpful coworkers and administrators who are invested in the success of their students and student workers.
cons: Lack of clear advancement opportunities and talent retention.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor, Economics in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Relatively easy job in a nice city. Great benefits package when compared to other academic jobs.
cons: Not too many higher career prospects after you leave the place, unless you work on your own.

review_title: good, but like other academic places, salaries are low
pros: good city, good people, can take courses for 10% fee which is great
cons: very few incentives to promotion, low salary

pros: Creative, international exposure, interesting projects
cons: lack of communication, low salary, inexperienced supervisors

review_title: Great place to work, even if opportunities to advance are limited.
job_title: Systems Programmer III in Pittsburgh, PA

Excellent benefits
Great people
Relaxed work atmosphere
Free Bus Pass

Hard to get pay increases

review_title: Start of a career after Master's
job_title: Research Technician IV in Pittsburgh, PA

cons: Poor pay and no growth in the job....

review_title: Great university to work and study

job_title: Associate Professor of Obstetrics, Gynecology, and Neonatal Medicine in Pittsburgh, PA

cons: With so many opportunities, one had to limit the projects taken on.

pros: Week paid off between Christmas and New Years.  Great retirement plan.  37.5 work week instead of 40. Only pay 10% of tuition at University of Pittsburgh.
cons: Paid monthly.  Low salary.

cons: No Guarantee on child education benefits. They change education benefit rules without notifying employees.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Great place to work at. Good facilities, reputed faculty members
cons: Less support for finding jobs in industry, specially at PhD level.

pros: Good benefits, lots of autonomy in my department, some nice, intelligent people to work with.
cons: For NTS, little to no job security, low pay, can feel cold and isolating in a large department.

review_title: It has been a very good place to work.
job_title: Research Assistant Professor in Pittsburgh, PA

cons: Due to constant demand to try to get funding, job can be stressful.

job_title: Research Specialist III in Pittsburgh, PA

review_title: I'm a pharmacy major at University of Pittsburgh
pros: Great people. Loved everyone and very helpful

pros: Great place and great benefits. Pittsburgh is an awesome city.

help me keep my grades up with late night studying

would be boring at times

review_title: Benefits do not make up for the many cons of working for Pitt.

review_title: Your mileage may vary depending on department

review_title: Students are Excellent, but the Admin Promises Low Wages

cons: University sees adjuncts as disposable despite the administration's reliance on them to continue offering competitive, top-tier education.

review_title: Great place to work if you value stability!
pros: Stability and benetits are great.  Personal growth and development are available.

review_title: Great benefits but low salary with little room for advancement or raises

cons: Low starting salary with little room for advancement

job_title: Career Services Director in Aliquippa, PA

pros: Flexible hours, and great people to work with !

job_title: Research Associate in New York, NY

Pittsburgh is a very relaxing city, a quiet, beautiful place to live.
University of Pittsburgh provides attractive benefit, excellent working environment.

job_title: Project Manager & Web Producer in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Great benefits.  Normal work day.  Low stress, Tuition free (for you and your family) if you qualify.

review_title: Research Staff underpaid for educational expectation

pros: Stable, experience, BENEFITS. Free public transportation, 8% match, great PTO, 90% $ postgrad, 100% $ undergrad

pros:
Great Benefits.
Paid Holidays, week off paid around the holidays.

cons: Low Pay, hard to get any meaningful salary increase.

pros: Worked around my class schedule. Invested in my growth as both a student and an information professional.

review_title: A great school with broad opportunities for faculty and staff

pros: If you're in health science areas, you'll be exposed with one of the best hospital in the nation.

flexible with schedule

pros: Great pay for no experience required. Very flexible with classes exams etc.

pros: The benefits and flexibility were great.

pros: creativity freedom, you learn more about your major than your actual degree.
